metadata.title: CVE-2017-7794 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
On Linux systems, if the content process is compromised, the sandbox broker will allow files to be truncated even though the sandbox explicitly only has read access to the local file system and no write permissions. Note: This attack only affects the Linux operating system. Other operating systems are not affected. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 55.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-7794` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 55.0.2+build1-0ubuntu4
firefox-geckodriver - 55.0.2+build1-0ubuntu4
firefox-mozsymbols - 55.0.2+build1-0ubuntu4
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs38 contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.0.2+build1-0ubuntu4').
